column4: Seriously, people...how do I get Pidgin to work like Empathy?
I'm not exactly sure what you mean 'to work like,' they are two very different programs
Empathy was tied to and controlled by the OS. The commands are still there (Session controls at the top right corner as well as away-on-screensaver), but I uninstalled Empathy
do you happen to be on Lucid?
Okay, without sauntering off with the words "I'll take that as a no," please explain to me WHAT Lucid is.
okay...it wasn't THAT bad, but it was unstable enough to scare me out of Lucid, considering I wanted working drivers and WINE.
Irony is I'm using the beta of WINE I believe.........
Oh *GOD* ...tell me...please...PLEASE tell me that in uninstalling Empathy I did NOT delete all my chat logs!!!
Where? x_X; will they load into Pidgin? x_x
I'm not sure if they will nicely or not, they are in one of your hidden folders, ~/.local/share/Empathy
...so the IAS controls keep logging me OUT
Every single time I use the IAS to control Pidgin, it logs me out of MSN... =_=
I have no idea, I haven't used Pidgin in a while
Ugh...now the IAS won't change off green at all...

At least it doesn't kill MSN every time I use it... =-=;;; I'll have to deal with it later. Each and every problem I have with it appears to be the result of either of two user errors: Not restarting /// leaving something on during installation...
How do I stick stuff in the programs drop-down for Wine? =_=;;;
